channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain mouth flattened causing flooding in gutter/road when raining., 10th November
item.description:
Drain outside number 3 Windermere road has been flattened. The opening for drain has been greatly reduced causing issues when raining. Flooding in gutter and out into the road from number 1 to the corner of Windermere Close. Been like this for a couple of years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Windermere Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked by leaves leading to surface water, 10th November
item.description:
The drain is located on the junction of Vittoria Walk and Oriel Road opposite the telephone exchange and adjacent to Oriel House. The issue has been present following leaf fall from the trees and has become problematic during the rain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Vittoria Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -other CW10 problem, 10th November
item.description:
Tarmac patch Approx 2000m x1000mmx45mm Un marked due to wet surface Stop and go TM required (CW10 Rutting&Depressions)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign/waymarker is damaged problem, 10th November
item.description:
Dear Public Rights of Way Team, I’m writing on behalf of a group of local riders based near Fiddington. With the ongoing housing developments and infrastructure expansion around Tewkesbury and Ashchurch, traffic levels on the surrounding roads have started to increase, and safe off-road routes for equestrians are becoming more limited. At present, there are very few bridleways directly accessible from the Fiddington area, and most existing routes require riders to travel along or cross roads where traffic is increasing. We would therefore be grateful if the council could consider whether there are any opportunities to improve bridleway access to the east of Fiddington, towards Oxenton and Gotherington, where the land remains largely rural and could provide safer riding options away from housing construction and traffic. There are several public footpaths in this area which appear on the map (attached) — if any of these could be considered for upgrading to bridleways, that would make a huge difference to local riders and improve overall network connectivity. Please see the attached map for reference; the X marks the approximate location of our yard, the pink lines show existing bridleways, and the red lines show the existing footpaths. If there are any current plans, consultations, or ways for the local equestrian community to support or feed into this process, we would be very interested in being involved. Kind regards, Ellie Mitchell
Report on FixMyStreet
